result.execSummary:
The defendant Javon Rhodes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javon Rhodes

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amy. 
Called:  3:24 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen. 
Defendant appears in custody from MCJ with Atty Paige Metzman. 

Date and time set for plea/sentencing; VRCW. 
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

State moves to DRI Count 2 (Disorderly Conduct/DA); COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to Count 1 (Battery/DA):   NO CONTEST.  

COURT ORDERS:  60 days MCJ; court costs including DNA sample/surcharge and Domestic Abuse surcharge.  COURT grants 45 days credit.  

Adj:  3:31 p.m.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 6, 2022 at 03:20 pm.

Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2022 at 11:10 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Jury Trial on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski; defendant appears by Attorney Paige Metzman; defendant in custody.  Parties continue negotiations and set matter for pretrial conference on May 23, at 11:10 am.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on April 14, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on August 4, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Jury Trial on September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

INCLUDES 22CF353 & 22CM284:  No contact with victim(s): T.M.W.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (3) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Case Called: 2:10 pm
INCLUDES 22CF353 & 22CM284.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen in person for ADA Natalie Zibolski.  Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Paige Metzman in person.
Parties state that the Defendant has an outstanding warrant from State of IL. 
Defendant needs to appear in person for the Extradition; Atty Metzman to be in contact with the Defendant re: Extradition request following hearing. 

VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA:  NOT GUILTY on Misd Charges. 

BOND: 
$2,500 Cash Bond to cover both files.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): T.M.W. or her residence.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

DATES:
PTC with JA/RH 04/14 @ 3:20 pm
JPTC/TPD 06/29 @ 10:30 am
JSH 08/04 @ 4:00 pm
JT 09/01 @ 9:00 am

Adjourned: 2:15 pm
